meanings.sent2: The car was gassed up before the long road trip.
meanings.sent3: The room gassed up with helium for the party.
meanings.sent4: The tire gassed up like a balloon ready to pop.
meanings.sent5: The gas tank gassed up the car for the journey.

meanings.sent1: After the party, he felt gassed from all the dancing.
meanings.sent2: The fans were gassed up for the big game.
meanings.sent3: The kids were gassed with joy when they saw the presents.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm gassed up the whole team.
meanings.sent5: The celebration gassed up the entire neighborhood.

meanings.definition: To be exhausted or worn out.
meanings.sent1: After the race, he was completely gassed.
meanings.sent2: She gassed out after a long day at work.
meanings.sent3: The puppy gassed out after playing all day.
meanings.sent4: The old car gassed out on the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The athlete gassed out before reaching the finish line.
